SEARCH
Package project.testmaster.backend.controller

Class AuthController

java.lang.Object
project.testmaster.backend.controller.AuthController
@RestController @RequestMapping(path="/api/auth") public class AuthController extends Object
Controller handling authentication-related operations for students and teachers. Provides endpoints for signing up and signing in.

  • Method Details

    • signupStudent

      @PostMapping("/signup/student") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> signupStudent(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid SignupRequestDTO request)
      Signs up a student by registering their details. Handles various actions such as saving student information to the database and managing errors such as conflicts or invalid data during the operation.
      Parameters:
      request - the student details required for signing up, encapsulated in a SignupRequestDTO. Includes fields like firstName, lastName, phoneNumber, email, and password.
      Returns:
      a org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> representing the outcome of the signup process: - HTTP 200 if the signup is successful. - HTTP 400 if there is a bad request due to validation issues. - HTTP 409 if a conflict occurs, such as duplicate student details. - HTTP 500 if an internal server error occurs.

    • signinStudent

      @PostMapping("/signin/student") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<SigninResponseDTO> signinStudent(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid SigninRequestDTO request)
      Handles the student sign-in process.
      Parameters:
      request - the request body containing the student's email and password for sign-in. Must be a valid SigninRequestDTO object.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing: - a SigninResponseDTO if the sign-in was successful (HTTP 200). - an HTTP 401 status if the provided credentials are unauthorized. - an HTTP 400 status if there is a bad request. - an HTTP 500 status in case of an internal server error.

    • signupTeacher

      @PostMapping("/signup/teacher") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> signupTeacher(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid SignupRequestDTO request)
      Handles the signing-up process for a teacher by receiving a signup request and processing it. Validates the provided data and persists the teacher's information if valid.
      Parameters:
      request - The data required for signing up a teacher encapsulated in a SignupRequestDTO object. Contains fields such as first name, last name, phone number, email, and password.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity object indicating the result of the signup operation: - 200 OK if the signup is successful. - 400 Bad Request if the provided input data is invalid. - 409 Conflict if there's an error due to a data integrity violation. - 500 Internal Server Error if an unexpected error occurs during the process.

    • signinTeacher

      @PostMapping("/signin/teacher") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<SigninResponseDTO> signinTeacher(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid SigninRequestDTO request)
      Signs in a teacher using the provided credentials.
      Parameters:
      request - The request containing the teacher's email and password. Must be a valid instance of SigninRequestDTO.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a SigninResponseDTO with a JWT token if the sign-in is successful, or an appropriate HTTP status in case of failure: - 200: Teacher signed in successfully - 400: Bad request - 401: Unauthorized - 500: Internal server error
